title: 115_s1046
content: The Act titled "Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act" facilitates projects related to pinyon-juniper in Lincoln County, Nevada. The Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act amends the Lincoln County Land Act of 2000 to allow for the development and implementation of comprehensive, cost-effective projects related to pinyon-juniper in Lincoln County, Nevada. The Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act allows for hazardous fuels reduction projects, wildfire prevention planning, and woodland restoration projects in Lincoln County, Nevada, particularly for pinyon-juniper dominated landscapes. The Director of the Bureau of Land Management will enter into cooperative agreements with the County for law enforcement and planning activities approved by the Secretary. The Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act allows for activities related to wilderness, cultural resources, Silver State OHV Trail, and land disposal planning in Lincoln County, Nevada. The Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act allows for various activities in Lincoln County, Nevada, including wilderness, cultural resources, Silver State OHV Trail, and land disposal planning. Additionally, the Act amends the Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 to include hazardous fuels reduction and wildfire prevention planning activities. The Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act allows for planning activities in Lincoln County, Nevada, including wilderness, cultural resources, and Silver State OHV Trail. The Director of the Bureau of Land Management will enter into cooperative agreements with the County for law enforcement and planning related activities approved by the Secretary. The Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act allows for planning activities in Lincoln County, Nevada, including wilderness, cultural resources, and the Silver State OHV Trail. The Act also addresses the disposition of proceeds under the Lincoln County Land Act of 2000 and the Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include economic development in addition to transportation. The Secretary of the Interior will realign the utility corridor to match a proposed map, removing it from specific areas. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include economic development. The utility corridor is being realigned in specific sections in Clark County, Nevada, as per a proposed map. Patent number 27-2005-0081 issued by the Bureau of Land Management is affirmed and validated. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include economic development. The process used by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service and the Bureau of Land Management in reconfiguring land for the benefit of the desert tortoise and other species is ratified. The issuance of Corrective Patent in Lincoln County, Nevada is also addressed. The Secretary of the Interior may issue a corrective patent for 7,548 acres of land in Lincoln County, Nevada, in compliance with the Nevada-Florida Land Exchange Authorization Act of 1988. SEC. 3. Boundary adjustments for Mt. Moriah Wilderness, High Schells Wilderness, and Arc Dome Wilderness. Amendments to the Pam White Wilderness Act include adjustments to the boundaries of the Mt. Moriah Wilderness and High Schells Wilderness. The Mt. Moriah Wilderness boundary is expanded to include specific lands identified on maps dated 2006 and 2017. The High Schells Wilderness boundary is adjusted to include specific lands and exclude others, as outlined in maps dated 2014 and 2017. Amendments to the Nevada Wilderness Protection Act of 1989 are made to reflect these changes. The Arc Dome Wilderness boundary is adjusted to exclude specific land identified as 'Exclude from Wilderness' on a map dated November 3, 2014. This adjustment is made under the White Pine County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act. The White Pine County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2006 is amended to include provisions for municipal water and sewer infrastructure, public electric transmission facilities, public broadband infrastructure, and processing of public land use authorizations and rights-of-way related to land development. The White Pine County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2006 is amended to convey land to White Pine County for the expansion of the Industrial Park, with specific provisions related to infrastructure development and rights-of-way. The White Pine County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2006 is amended to convey land to White Pine County for the expansion of the Industrial Park, with specific provisions related to infrastructure development and rights-of-way. A deadline is set for the Secretary to convey the land to the County by December 31, 2018, or else all right, title, and interest of the United States in the land will be conveyed to the County without consideration.
